text: Moving through a murky haze.  Dark blues and greens, shaf of prismed purple.  A pale shard appears in the distance. Gliding closer, a group of tiny fish dart before the came We're UNDERWATER.  Arriving at the form, it finally sharp into focus.  It's a WOMAN'S BODY submerged in dark water, arms floating lazily at her side.  The face is obscured b flowing hair.  All that is visible is a pair of COLD, STA GREEN EYES, which blink closed...

...then open as BLUE EYES, as a DIFFERENT FACE emerges fr water.  CLAIRE SPENCER awakens from this unsettling dream her bathtub.  She pivots the large BRASS SHOWER HEAD (the kind that moves up and down on a pipe) off to one side, reaches toward her feet and we hear the sound of a plug b pulled.

A HAZY SHAPE-- accompanied by a whirring sound. A steam covered mirror is cleared with a BLOW DRYER.  Cla starts to come into focus.  The dryer stops.  She presses red G.F.I. button on the socket.  ZAP!  A big blue spark shoots out.  Claire pulls her hand back...and the dryer starts whirring again. She clears the mirror and replaces the dryer on a hook. regards herself in the mirror, and attractive, elegant- looking woman around forty. Claire traces a finger along a small but noticeable SCAR above her left eye, then slowly drops the hand to her che as if confirming her existence.
Claire, now dressed, presses her face against a door, listening for the sounds of stirring from within.  Silenc She quietly pushes open the door.

Claire makes her way past half-filled boxes and duffels t window, then pulls the curtains to reveal: A LOVELY, WOODED LAKE.  It couldn't be more picturesque. 24' SAILBOAT is moored at the dock and an OLD STONE LIGHTHOUSE sits on a point across the lake. The sunlight motivates an unconscious groan from A FIGURE still shrouded by covers. Claire sits beside the sleeping form.  She scans the room briefly, taking in a Greenpeace flag and a picture of a tomboyish ten year-old girl at camp. She gently pulls back the covers and peers down at the sa face, now a waifish, pretty seventeen year-old, with chop hair and tiny nose ring.  Claire leans over and inhales t sleeping scent of her only daughter, CAITLIN.  She places hand on a cheek.  The girl's eyelids flutter softly.
Morning, beauty. Caitlin lets out a grunt and rolls over onto her belly.
Let's go.  Or we'll never leave on time. From out of the pillow comes Caitlin's voice.
(muffled) I'm totally ready. Claire glances around at the piles of unpacked clothes.
Come on, I'll make you some waffles, maybe we'll squeeze in a trip to the mall. (beat) Caitlin... Claire gently swats at the tiny lump that is Caitlin's behind.
Mother... Claire stands and instinctively scoops up some clothes fr the floor, then folds and neatly stacks them on a box. Caitlin turns her head sideways on the pillow.
You're such a morning person. Claire turns at the door.
It is unwise to heckle the keeper of the plastic. She starts to leave.  Caitlin calls out.
Blueberries! Claire smiles as she closes the door behind her.
Claire bends down to pick up one of Caitlin's socks.  Whe she stands, something catches her eye out a window.  She gazes down, transfixed.

Through a stand of trees over a HIGH WOODEN FENCE, A YOUN COUPLE is in the midst of a heated argument next door. Claire watches as the HUSBAND, a large imposing man with unruly shock of red hair, snarls at his wife across the h of their huge old Buick.  She tries to get a glimpse of t woman, but all that's visible is THE BACK OF HER BLOND HE A TAN, SINEWY ARM encircles Claire's waist.  She lets out small gasp as a hand closes on her breast.  It's Claire's husband, DR. NORMAN SPENCER, nibbling gently at her neck. He's older than she, pushing fifty, with silver streaks beginning to permeate the shaggy mop of hair that makes h look more like a preppy rocker or a lacrosse coach than t prominent academic that he is.  Claire, however, can't ta her eyes off the scene below.
They at it again? Claire nods.
Christ, that's twice in...When did they move in?
I think three...
Three weeks. She continues to gaze downward.  The man leans over the h murmuring darkly at his wife, though for Claire and Norma the scene is entirely silent.
What's their name?

Feur, I think.  Psych department.  Figures. They're all psychotic. Outside, Mr. Feur turns and walks toward his house.  Norm begins, once again, to nuzzle Claire.  Her eyes close, bu then she gently demurs.
She's awake.
We'll be quiet.  Quick and quiet. She turns to him.
I don't want to be either. He smiles.  A really good smile.  The lips and tongue on faded T-shirt mark him as a 'Stones fan.
When's she out of here?
Norman Spencer. Norman gives up.  He busses her cheek.
(moving toward the stairs) Alright.  I can't take the rejection.  I'm going to class.
Don't.
Claire, I have to show up for the--
It's Saturday. Norman stops.
I knew that.  You think I didn't know that? She smiles at him.  After a beat:
It's today?
(wistfully) Yep. They share a warm, poignant look.  He turns and moves dow the stairs.

(calling over his shoulder) We're going to have to leave by three if we want to beat the traffic. Claire returns her gaze to the scene below as Mr. Feur sa something ominous to his wife, then stalks into the house
Claire?
(absently) Three o'clock.
Mrs. Feur drops her face into her hands.
Claire peruses her "to do" list as Caitlin munches a pani
...and I still think we should get you some mittens. Caitlin puts down the sandwich and regards her mother war The bond between them is palpable.
Do you have a scarf?
Hey. Claire looks up from her little pad of paper.
Yes?
It's only two hours away.
I know that.
I'll come back all the time.
Of course you will.
I'm just saying, you're going to be fine. Claire smiles.

Sweetheart, I've known this day was coming for a long time.  I've got your father and the garden and the new house. You really don't have to worry. Caitlin smiles back and nods, her face betraying some concern.  Claire takes her hand.
Really. She nods reassuringly and pulls Caitlin into an embrace. eyes close.
Mother...
Claire's frozen in the hug.
(beat) Mom. Her eyes open.  Widen to reveal Claire, holding Caitlin o the college campus.  The URBAN SKYLINE looms in the background.
I have'ta go. After a moment's hesitation, she releases her grip.  Cait glances over her shoulder to make sure no one's witnessed this overt display of maternal affection.
I'll call you. Claire produces an ENVELOPE, which she presses into her daughter's hand.  It's a book of TRAIN TICKETS.
Come home anytime. Caitlin looks at Norman.
Really gonna leave me, huh? She nods.  They share a tender look.
Be good. She throws her arm, briefly, tightly around his waist.  A overwhelmed, he slowly brings his hand to the back of Caitlin's head.  After a moment, she steps back...
Bye. ...then turns and makes her way toward the large, old Columbia dorm.  A banner is draped across its portals whi reads:

Claire watches her daughter melt into a crowd of similarl shaggy freshmen, smoking and talking on the front steps. eyes are shining.  Norman wraps an arm around her waist a she daps at a tear with a Kleenex.
(smiling) I almost made it. They turn and head for the car.  Claire sneaks one last l over her shoulder.
Caitlin glancing back at Claire with an apprehensive smil

Claire walks in from the bathroom wearing a sexy cotton nightgown.  Norman is in bed, absorbed in some notes. She gets into bed, then picks up a thick text from beside and starts reading.  After a moment:
Whatcha reading?
(reading the cover, sexy voice) Genetic repair mechanisms in eukaryotic organisms.
(slight smile) How is it? Claire snuggles up.
Excellent.  Couple of Swedish sailor cells just gang divided a virginal cheerleader cell.
(lost in his book) Nice. (beat) Almost done. She pulls slightly away.
If you have to work...
No, no.  I'm just about... (beat) There. He places his book on the bedside table and turns to her.
How are you?
Fine.
It's okay if you're not.
I am, really.
It's just she's been the focus for a while.
Not the focus.
You know what I mean. Claire thinks for a moment.
To tell you the truth...I'm excited.
You are...
To get my life back.  To have some time for myself.  Some time for us. He caresses her.
You did a great job.  She's a good kid.
We did. There's a weighty pause.
It's just us now.
I know. He kisses her.
Tired?
Nope.
Wanna fool around?
Yup. They start to kiss.  It's slow and a bit methodical in th manner of long time lovers.  Suddenly, the SOUND OF A WOM WAILING can be heard.  They stop.
Did you...
Shhh. They listen.  The sounds start to become louder.  It is clearly two people in the throes of some very vocal and savage love making.
Jesus. He walks over and closes the window.  It doesn't help.
I guess they're making up. The woman's moaning becomes embarrassingly loud.
What is he doing to her? They lie together in silence as the cacophony drones on.
And we moved out here for the quiet.
Mmm. Beat.  The mood has passed.
Maybe we should just...
Tomorrow.
I'm finished at three.  No.  Squash with Stan.
After that.
I'll be there. Beat.
Love you. She smiles.
Night. They lie together in the darkness as the Feurs finally climax.

Claire pushes open the door to Caitlin's room carrying an armful of FOLDED LAUNDRY.  She moves quickly to the burea not wanting to spend much time in here, then grabs a TINY BLACK TOP from the pile, and drops it into a drawer.  She just about to close it, when something catches her eye.

She drops the laundry and slowly pulls a tattered, old JUILLIARD T-SHIRT with a very seventies logo from the dra Claire gazes around the room, which is a reliquary of Caitlin's recently concluded childhood; PICTURES, TROPHIE STUFFED ANIMALS. She brings the now faded T-shirt to her face and drinks i the smells.  She stares down at the word "Juilliard."

"JUILLIARD"...now it's on the same T-shirt only Claire's wearing it and she's much younger.  It's an old photograp an album.  Younger Norman stands next to her in the shot, arm draped around her waist.  A CELLO CASE stands beside Claire glances around at several hastily unpacked boxes a sees propped in the corner...THE CELLO CASE.  She gazes a other photos. -- Claire in her wedding dress, Norman beside her in a tu with a very wide bow-tie. -- Claire and Norman in front of a UNIVERSITY BUILDING. tiny Caitlin rests on her hip. Claire's chin begins to tremble and she chokes out a sob.

Her face streaked with tears, Claire stumbles out into th immaculately manicured ROSE GARDEN. The yard is surrounded by a HIGH WOODEN FENCE.  She colla into a lawn chair as the tears begin to subside.  Suddenl she hears something coming from next door. She cocks her head and attempts to make out the sound.  I is, ironically, the sound of a WOMAN CRYING.  Claire make her way over to the fence.  The women's sobbing becomes m plaintive and fevered. She places her face against the prickly, vine covered fen and tries to peer through the crack.  All she can make ou A DARK BLUE BLUR that seems to be rocking.  Claire gather her nerve and calls out...
Hello... There's no reaction.
Mrs. Feur? The sobbing chokes down to a breathless whimpering.  The shape vanishes from view.
Wait a minute.  I just want-- Something bumps against the fence.  Claire draws back.  S hears heavy breathing.
(sniffling) Who are you?
It's Mrs...It's Claire...Spencer.  From next door.  Is everything--
You're the flower lady.
Um...yes.
I've seen you.  From the window.
Is everything alright? Claire leans closer to the tiny crack.  She sees a fleshy blur and what might be part of an eye.  There's no respon just the breathing.
Hello?
I'm not... She seems on the verge of losing it again.
He's so...it's too much...and I can't...I can't breath...
Who?  Your husband?
And I'm afraid.  Oh god, I'm so afraid of... She trails off.
What?  What are you afraid of?
I can't, no, no, I can't... Claire edges closer to the crack.
Tell me.  Please.
That I'll just...that one day I'll just...disappear. Beat.  Claire's taken aback by this admission.
Tell me.  I can help you.
How?  How can you help me?  With your flowers and your perfect life...
That's not...It's not like that.
I've never even met you.
I know.  And I'm sorry.  I've been consumed with...my daughter left...for school.
This fence...it's so...
I'm sorry.  It's for the flowers.  Why don't you... Tires can be heard crunching the gravel as a car pulls in the Feur's driveway.
Oh God.  He's back.  I'm sorry.  Please forget that I...I don't know what I'm saying.  Please...

Wait!  Don't go... Claire listens to the sound of NAKED FOOTSTEPS, followed LARGE FRONT DOOR swinging shut.  A CAR DOOR swings open a MAN'S SHOES follow down the path. Claire pulls back from the crack and leans against the fe as the door closes a second time.  She sits there for a moment listening, but all is quiet.
She sounded terrified.
Claire and Norman eat dinner.  A rainstorm pelts the wind
Of what?
Of him I think.
Did she say that?
More or less. Norman chews.
Honey, they're young.  They're probably newlyweds.
I'm telling you.  There was something in her voice...
Remember how we were?
Not like this.  We were never like this. (beat) I want to go over there.  After dinner, we can--
Why?
To make sure she's all right. Norman puts down his fork.
Claire, honey, we are not going to march next door and accuse our new neighbor of--
(overlapping) That's not what I'm sug--
...when tonight they'll probably be keeping us awake.
But what if something happens?
Claire...
I'd never be able to live with mysel--
(reassuring) Nothing's going to happen. (beat) Besides, I have to work tonight.  The conference is in less than two weeks. I've got to stay focused on that for just a little longer. (beat) This is...
I know.
It's what I've been working for. She glances down at her untouched plate.
I just wish you could have heard her.
Look, I'll call Harvey Tomes in the Psych department, see what I can find out.
Promise? He gives her a "Didn't I just say so" look.  She smiles.
I'll make you some coffee. She reaches for his plate to clear it.  Norman grabs her and kisses it.

Norman snores softly.  Claire is awakened by the continui STORM.  She pads out to Norman's turreted library.  Rain pelts the glass.  Her face is briefly illuminated by the LIGHTHOUSE BEAM. She hears the sound of a DOOR CLOSING and moves to get a better view of the Feur's.  Nothing but blackness.  Just she's turning to go back to bed.  A LIGHTNING FLASH light the night.  Claire's eyes go wide.
In the split second of brilliance, she sees Mr. Feur, in shirtsleeves, drenched, dragging A LARGE DUFFEL toward th open trunk of his car.
(in a hoarse whisper) Norman! He's dead to the world.  She calls to him again.
Norman, you have to look at this!
Mmnph.
Hurry... Another flash illuminates...Norman at her side.
Look! ...an EMPTY DRIVEWAY, then blackness.
What is it?  What's the matter? She stares down into the darkness.
Nothing.  There was...I thought I saw something.
Is it gone? THE BEACON illuminates the empty driveway.  She nods.
Come on, let's go back to bed. Yet another bolt of lightning reveals Claire, still at th window.

Claire sets up a camera and tripod.  She steps back and a her camera.  She glances up at a large upstairs window at FEUR'S HOUSE.  One side of the curtain seems to be pulled open, but no one's there. Feeling self-conscious, she turns back to the camera.  Th morning sun hits the flowers just right and she SNAPS SEV PICTURES OF THEM against her lovely house. She glances back at the Feur's window.  The CURTAIN IS NO CLOSED. She walks over to the fence and tries to peek through it. When this doesn't work, she drags a lawn chair over and p across the fence.  She can barely see over, but glimpses: A DEEP FURROW in the mud of the driveway.  Just then, a c pulls into the driveway, Claire scrambles down from her perch.
Claire walks out to find her best friend, JODY, pretty, i her forties, wearing hip, hippie-ish clothes.
Hey there. Jody hugs her.
How you holding up?
Good.  I'm good.
You are?
Why does everyone find that so surprising?
(are you kidding?) Cause...your...only daughter just went away to school...who you were incredibly close with aaand I'd be tripping...
Okay, I'm a little tender.
Well good.  So you're human.
And so far my day has consisted of taking pictures of my roses for the garden club.
Wow.  Got here just in time. (reaching into her bag) I brought you this. She proffers several homemade tea bags.
What is it?
Kambucha mushroom tea...
Jody--
It soothes heart-ache and promotes psychic wellness.  Sela suggested I bring--
You're discussing me with your psychic?
She's not a psychic.  Just a very enlightened spirit.
Thanks, but I'm fine.
(pressing it into her hand) So you'll have some later. (beat) Notice anything...different? Claire gives her friend the once over, then notices the m Karman-Ghia behind her.
Oh my god.  You bought it.
Yep.
It's niiice.
Beautiful thing, alimony.  Lose a husband, get a car.  Think it'll help me pick up dudes?
Absolutely.
Listen, I've gotta run.  I just thought I'd stop by and see if you want to take the boat out, say Thursday morning?
You got it. Jody grins.

See you then. Jody drives off.  Claire walks down the driveway to her f door and sees Mr. Feur staring at her from a window.  She starts to wave, but the curtain is drawn shut. Claire arrives at the front door and reaches out to touch doorknob.  She stops.  A FAINT RUSTLING can be heard from within.  Claire quietly opens the door and moves into:
Claire stops inside the door.  Now it sounds like WHISPER Two voices, tense, impassioned.  It seems to be coming fr Norman's study.  She gathers her nerve, then bursts into room.
But the whispering has suddenly stopped.
Hello? The lovely circular room is completely empty.  She looks around, puzzled.  Cooper, the family's aging lab, casuall ambles over.
(to Cooper) Please tell me you heard that.

Claire and Cooper, out on a walk, emerge onto large rocks the water's edge.  Claire tosses a long stick for Cooper, bolts out onto the LONG WOODEN DOCK.  Claire gazes at the LIGHTHOUSE across the lake and a long BRIDGE in the dista Cooper starts BARKING and looking down into the water. Claire arrives at Cooper's side and stares down into the water.

Cooper...what do you see? She looks down and sees nothing but her own reflection. After a moment, she notices a FAINT WHITE SHAPE directly the reflection of her face.  Cooper rumbles a low growl. shape seems to be gaining definition.
Claire gasps quietly, then reaches into a pocket in her sweater and pulls out a cordless phone.
(into phone) Hi.
(on the other end) I'm stuck here for another couple of hours. Claire's smile fades.
Oh.
Unless you need me to come home...
No, no.  It's fine. Claire slowly leans out over the water to check her reflection...
You sure? ...but the shape is gone.
Claire?
Huh?  Absolutely.  Take your time. She clicks off the phone and looks down at the calm water
Claire sits in a small workroom at a computer.  She focus intently on the screen.
It's ALICE'S COMPUTER SOLITAIRE.  She flips the last card an animated Queen of Hearts, accompanied by a series of musical notes, parades across the screen.
(on computer) You lost!  Off with your head! Claire hits "New Game" and watches as a fresh hand of cyb solitaire is dealt.  She suddenly has a thought and disappears into the kitchen.
She glances at Jody's tea, smiles, then refills her glass red wine.  She picks up the phone from its cradle and mov into:
She dials a number.  LOUD REGGAE can be heard blaring thr the phone.
(straining to be heard) Hello?  I'm looking for Caitlin Spencer. She's in 314...Well, could you check? She plugs one ear.

Oh.  Well, just tell her that her mother called.  Her mother.  Thank you.  Excuse me, how can you study with that? The noise abruptly stops.  Claire clicks off the phone an replaces it in the sweater pocket.  She tunes the stereo classical music station.
She walks in, places the cordless phone on a BASE UNIT, t hears a different set of musical notes from the computer. She stares at the screen, stunned.
The game has been finished.  Cards with faces swarm chaotically across the screen with the message:  YOU WIN!
Oh.  Kay. Without warning, the radio dial rips cacophonously past several stations and comes to a stop on some angry, punki rock and roll.

Jesus... She bolts around a corner to the stereo.  The music is chaotic and deafening.  She finds Cooper growling at...no one.  She turns off the stereo.  Cooper suddenly bolts do the hall.  She follows him.
The foyer's empty, but the front door is open.  Claire nervously walks out and looks around.
Cooper!

No sign of the dog. Claire turns to go back inside.  When she touches the doorknob, she hears the whispering again.  A fleeting sha draws her eye to a COAT RACK MIRROR which reflects direct into the study.
Hello...?! The whispering stops.

Claire walks in to find Norman surrounded by several GRAD STUDENTS.  At school he's a very different man; pressed s and tie, hair neatly brushed back.  They're preforming so unseen procedure on a live sheep in a containment harness She stops by the door to watch him.
...and then what...Courtney? An intense ASIAN GIRL answers.
We administer the Halothane.
Dosage? She glances at her notes.
Three point five cc's.
Excellent.  Properties?  Andrew from downtown... Andrew, tall razor thin, was waiting for this.
An organic, neuromuscular blocking agent, which when administered in aerosol form temporarily renders the subject immobile.
Nothing but net. He measures out the liquid from a blue plastic bottle int apparatus connected to an inhalation mask on the sheep.

Prudence here's an old friend. He moves to the sheep's head and strokes it as he nods to Courtney who turns a valve on the apparatus.  The sheep suddenly goes completely still.  Norman moves around and begins a brief procedure.
I try to stay on her good side because I owe her my career and most of our grant money.  Why else? He completes the procedure.  They look at him blankly.
Always do unto others as you'd have others do unto your ewe. Groans, laughter.  He stops Claire.
That'll do it.  Write this up for Tuesday! Andrew and Amy tend to Prudence, the rest leave.  Claire moves over to him.  They kiss.  Norman packs notes and so of the chemicals into a LEATHER CASE.
(warm) What are you doing here?
There were some noises.  I didn't want to disturb you. She watches as the sheep slowly becomes reanimated and is out of the room.
What do you mean?  Some noises where?
In the house.  I was scared.
Did you call the police?
No.  Can you drive me home?  I'll bring you back in the morning.
Of course. He takes her arm.
Norman pushes open the front door.  Cooper pads over, wag his tail.  They walk together past the stereo into...
...the living room.  All is quiet.  They move into...
It's undisturbed.  Norman checks the window locks.
It was there.  This angry music all by itself.  And I heard whispering.
What kind of whispering?
I don't know.  Just...whispering. He nods as Cooper appears.
What'd you see, Coop? The dog stares blankly.
(to Cooper) Tell him! Norman smiles.
Norman sits on the bed and pulls off his shoes.
I'm gonna have the police check on the house. Claire leans against the window sill.
Oh great, "Can you look in on my wife, she's hearing voices?"  Wait'll that gets around. He walks over to her.
I've got the conference next week.  I want you to feel safe.
I do, I do.  I'm sure I'm just...how was your day? He goes to his dresser and fishes a little joint from a b in his dresser.
Think I may have cracked it.
Really? She produces a match and lights it.  They sit on the bed.
I think so.  Maybe.
You are so brilliant.
Yep.
Madame Curie, Jonas Salk, Norman Spencer...
(smiling) You know what that does to me. She takes a little puff on the joint as he kisses her nec
(stopping) Ohmigod.  You'll never believe...I saw Schumway...
You're kidding.
He's here giving some arcane spiel for the physics department, so Bob Shine introduces us...
Wow. He nods, Claire passes the joint back.
And he says...you'll fucking love this, he says, "Doctor Spencer, I am a great admirer of your work..."
Well, that's nice.
"...especially Spencer's Theorem..."
(overlapping) Oh, no...
"...of Perpetual Distances." (beat) Everybody's checking their shoelaces. Pins drop.  "I'm afraid you've mistaken me,"  I say...
(overlapping) That's...
"...for my father."
I'm so sorry.
Didn't know he was dead, every stinking paper on the globe.
That's just mean. (indicating joint) Oh.  Jody wanted to know if I could get her some.
(quickly glancing over) Did you tell her?
What?  No.  No.
You didn't?
(with a smile) Norman, you are so funny about that.  No, I didn't. He takes a little toke, then vanishes into the bathroom.
Cause that would be really-- She lays back on the bed.  Sounds of flushing.
I didn't. He reappears without the joint.
Sorry.  You understand.
Did you call about the Feurs?
Oh, right.  Yes.  Harvey says the guy's a sweetheart.  Wouldn't hurt a fly.
Huh. Claire ponders this.  Norman turns off the light and join her on the bed.  He kisses her knee.
Do the brilliant Norman stuff some more. Then starts working his way up her thigh.
And speak up. Claire smiles.

Claire sits frozen, cello between her legs, bow hovering position.  After an uncomfortable long pause, she touches to string, drawing in a breath at the power of the sound. Claire takes another deep breath, then launches into a beautiful and melancholy piece of music.  She's very, ver good.  Eyes closed.  Her body begins to sway slightly as left hand vibratos like butterfly wings on the neck. She reaches a difficult transition and falters.  She seem almost surprised.  She attacks the transition again, and again falters.  Claire bites her lower lip and tries yet again, this time failing completely. She sits back in the chair, despondent.  Almost as an afterthought, she sadly drags the bow across strings.  At end of the tone, something catches her ear.  She can just make out the HINT OF A FAINT FEMININE VOICE echoing the t She sits up and plays a different note, then another.  Ea time the soft mournful voice becomes more distinct.  Fina she plays a sharp, higher pitched note.  The voice echoes with a distinct, unsettling shriek.

Claire walks in and sees: INSERT-- Lying on the floor...A FRAMED NEWSPAPER PHOTOGRA OF NORMAN AND CLAIRE. The caption announces that he's being promoted to the "distinguished DUPONT CHAIR IN GENETICS."  Through the spiderwebbed glass, Norman can be seen shaking hands with older academic, hugging a smiling Claire to his side. Claire kneels down to gather the picture.  A single shard glass is missing.  She finds it a foot away by a distinct knot in the wood floor. She notices a COPPER GLINT in the point of glass, but whe she moves it, it's gone.  She places the pieces of broken glass on the frame and stands. Out of the window directly in front of her sees:  Mr. Feu removing a DIRT COVERED SHOVEL from his trunk.  She glanc down at the picture, then back up at Mr. Feur, who carrie the shovel around back.
Oh no... Claire wraps up the broken picture.  She hears a car door slam and glances out the window in time to see Mr. Feur driving off.
A stiff autumn breeze.  Claire stands at the fence.
Mrs. Feur? She looks through the tiny crack.  Nothing.
Hello? (beat) Are you there? Silence.
Claire glances down as she walks past THE FURROW.  She lo up at the house, which seems quite placid, then slowly he around back.
She takes in the lake view from the large porch.  The win really blowing.  Her eye catches on something.  Propped against the back door...

Claire takes a pinch of soil from the shovel and tastes i then knocks at the back door.  There's no answer.  She kn again.  Nothing.  She's turning to go, then the door swin open.  The smile fades from Claire's face.
The immense MR. FEUR filling the doorway.
Yes?
Um...
I'm running late here.  I just came back for my briefcase.
Right.  Well, I wanted to stop by to welcome you to the uh, to the neighborhood.  I'm Claire Spencer.  From next door.
This really isn't a good time. He starts to close the door.
Well maybe your wife...
(growing cold) She isn't here.
When...when will she be back?
I don't know.
Oh-kay...
I have to go. Slam.  And Claire is staring at a closed door.
What do you mean she's gone?
Claire and Jody knife slowly through the water in the Spencer's sailboat heading back toward the dock, the OLD LIGHTHOUSE, the BRIDE in the background.
